title: Is it ok to troll as a support?
body:
Maybe he isn't an usual pick bot, but Trundle does have great lane sustain even when not farming, decent peeling with the pillar, and him stealing stats from the enemy tank both makes him tankier and makes it easier for the adc to take the enemy tank down...
Also his Q steals AD, which could make lane trades and engages safer.

Trundle is a "troll" support only in the sense that he is a literal troll. He's been played competitively for years even as a support. He is mostly picked to punish immobile enemy adc's and melee supports via ulting to steal their tank stats. He's not a bad pick at all in the right matchup; however, he is situational and needs time to really come online.

Nice bait.

But yeah, I'm not going to bat an eye if my support picks something unconventional (e.g. {{champion:78}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:48}} ) provided it makes sense for the match up and my support is comfortable with that pick.

Funny bait.

Anyway, Trundle as a support is good when the enemy bot lane has a tank support, and/or there is a high impact/threat tank on the enemy team that your ult's resist shred is worth using for.   Other then that he has fair peel and can mess up AD based divers rather badly with his AD steal on his Q.  Trundle support's ideal meta is a meta with 1-2 tanks, an AD assassin mid or jungle, and a lack of powerful kiting and/or peel on the enemy team.

It is never okay to troll as a support.

depends on the matchup. trundle--along with most melee AD champs--gets zoned out pretty easily by a lot of conventional ADCs but his big defensive statpool means that he can soak up a mean burst. he's definitely not the worst of the melee ADs to send down there because he gets a ton of free sustain thru his passive (his HP5 at lv.1 is pretty meh to offset this but has a really high growth-coefficient).
